holidays.name: Donald Duck Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the iconic Disney character Donald Duck, known for his semi-intelligible voice and fiery temper.
holidays.origin: Celebrates the release date of Donald Duck‚Äôs first cartoon, 'The Wise Little Hen,' in 1934.
holidays.funFact: Donald Duck‚Äôs full name is Donald Fauntleroy Duck, and he has a sister named Della Duck!

holidays.name: National Strawberry Rhubarb Pie Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to enjoying the tangy and sweet combination of strawberry and rhubarb in pie form.
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday celebrating the popular spring-summer dessert in the U.S.
holidays.funFact: Rhubarb is technically a vegetable but is treated as a fruit in pies because of its tart flavor.

holidays.name: Unfriend Day
holidays.description: A quirky social media holiday encouraging people to clean up their friend lists by 'unfriending' inactive or fake accounts.
holidays.origin: A relatively new internet-era observance aimed at encouraging healthier digital interactions.
holidays.funFact: Unfriend Day humorously reminds us that it‚Äôs okay to curate our social circles for mental peace.

holidays.name: Bring Your Teddy Bear to Work Day
holidays.description: Encourages adults to bring a childhood teddy bear to work for comfort, nostalgia, and a little whimsy.
holidays.origin: An unofficial day to reduce work stress and promote a playful atmosphere.
holidays.funFact: Studies show having a comforting object like a teddy bear can actually reduce stress levels!
